verses.english: A challenger<sup foot_note=77543>1</sup> has demanded a punishment bound to come
for the disbelievers—to be averted by none—
from Allah, Lord of pathways of ˹heavenly˺ ascent,

verses.arabic: تَعْرُجُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِى يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُۥ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
verses.english: ˹through which˺ the angels and the ˹holy˺ spirit<sup foot_note=77544>1</sup> will ascend to Him on a Day fifty thousand years in length.<sup foot_note=77545>2</sup>
So endure ˹this denial, O  Prophet,˺ with beautiful patience.
They truly see this ˹Day˺ as impossible,
but We see it as inevitable.
On that Day the sky will be like molten brass
and the mountains like ˹tufts of˺ wool.
And no close friend will ask ˹about˺ their friends,

verses.arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ ۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِى مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍۭ بِبَنِيهِ
verses.english: ˹although˺ they will be made to see each other. The wicked will wish to ransom themselves from the punishment of that Day by their children,
their spouses, their siblings,
their clan that sheltered them,

verses.arabic: وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
verses.english: and everyone on earth altogether, just to save themselves.
But no! There will certainly be a raging Flame
ripping off scalps.
It will summon whoever turned their backs ˹on Allah˺ and turned away ˹from the truth˺,
and gathered and hoarded ˹wealth˺.
Indeed, humankind was created impatient:
distressed when touched with evil,
and withholding when touched with good—
except those who pray,
consistently performing their prayers;
and who give the rightful share of their wealth
to the beggar and the poor;
and who ˹firmly˺ believe in the Day of Judgment;

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
verses.english: and those who fear the punishment of their Lord—
˹knowing that˺ none should feel secure from their Lord’s punishment—
and those who guard their chastity<sup foot_note=77546>1</sup>

verses.arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزْوَٰجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
verses.english: except with their wives or those ˹bondwomen˺ in their possession,<sup foot_note=77547>1</sup> for then they are free from blame,

verses.arabic: فَمَنِ ٱبْتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْعَادُونَ
verses.english: but whoever seeks beyond that are the transgressors.
˹The faithful are˺ also those who are true to their trusts and covenants;
and who are honest in their testimony;
and who are ˹properly˺ observant of their prayers.
These will be in Gardens, held in honour.
So what is the matter with the disbelievers that they rush ˹head-long˺ towards you ˹O Prophet˺,
from the right and the left, in groups ˹to mock you˺?<sup foot_note=77548>1</sup>

verses.arabic: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ
verses.english: Does every one of them expect to be admitted into a Garden of Bliss?
But no! Indeed, they ˹already˺ know what We created them from.<sup foot_note=77549>1</sup>

verses.arabic: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْمَشَـٰرِقِ وَٱلْمَغَـٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَـٰدِرُونَ
verses.english: So, I do swear by the Lord of ˹all˺ the points of sunrise and sunset<sup foot_note=77550>1</sup> that We are truly capable

verses.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
verses.english: of replacing them with ˹others˺ better than them, and We cannot be prevented ˹from doing so˺.

verses.arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا۟ وَيَلْعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يُلَـٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ
verses.english: So let them indulge ˹in falsehood˺ and amuse ˹themselves˺ until they face their Day, which they have been threatened with—

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ
verses.english: the Day they will come forth from the graves swiftly, as if racing to an idol ˹for a blessing˺,<sup foot_note=77551>1</sup>

verses.arabic: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ
verses.english: with eyes downcast, utterly covered with disgrace. That is the Day they have ˹always˺ been warned of.
